page.title: 04INTERVIEW - BROWN FARM
page.content: The nearest shop is two miles away in Huish Champflower and the nearest shopping centre of any size is Wiveliscombe over seven miles away. Even this is only a small town and for larger purchases the residents must go to Wellington or Taunton. It is therefore necessary to own a car if you live in this area. The nearest post box is one a mile away at Sperry Cross but the postman calls at the farm each day. The fishmonger calls once a fortnight and the baker once a week. The nearest schools are in Wiveliscombe, both primary and comprehensive. Brown farms are at the end of the catchment area and the children travel to and from school by minibus. There are vets and doctors in Wiveliscombe and a blacksmith at Dulverton.
